Don't have to worry about splashes by the pool, but watch out for high temps in the sun. Of course that was true in the 35mm days, so no real difference.One of the one-star reviews said all pictures were fuzzy. Low-light without flash is not the greatest. But low-light (high ISO) is a problem for the high dollar DSLRs. There is a setting on W80 besides the pixel setting that affects quality. It makes a sharper picture, but uses more memory. No problem, with an 8GB chip, I can shoot about 2,000 before I run out of memory. It really does make the picture sharper.I used a card reader to get the files into my computer. I like having a $10 card reader + regular USB cable instead of the $200 camera + proprietary USB cable for that purpose.The camera makes JPGs for stills and AVIs for movies. The files are compatible with everything. I was able to edit the AVIs with Nero and make a DVD. When you make a DVD, you lose a small amount of quality. If I had a BluRay burner, I would make BluRays to keep the HD quality.Don't expect this to replace a Nikon D or Canon EOS camera. It won't. But if you want a camera that will survive the water park, canoeing, beach, hiking, etc., this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for wet or rough activities
Reviews.Author: Mark Whitesell
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit of a camera junkie - I've owned at least a dozen cameras including SLRs as well as point-and-shoot (P+S).  My biggest gripe with P+S is that eventually dust or moisture will get inside the camera resulting in total failure or at the very least, dust will land on the image sensor rendering the camera useless.  A sealed water-proof camera is the answer for me even though I have no intention of going underwater with it... still, I hike and backpack so mist and rain are just as much an issue for me.As for the graininess of the images - most of this can be avoided by learning how the camera settings affect the final image.  For such a small camera, there are an amazing (daunting?) number of options so the beginning user may not find this a good match for them.The triple-shake-reduction method was a pleasant surprise for me (but yes, it does introduce a fair amount of image noise).  I often shoot in low-light conditions without the flash and using other cameras, my usability success rate was under 50%.  With this camera it's upwards of 95% success.  For me, I'd rather have sharp yet "grainy" images than blurry "fine-grained" images that end up totally useless.  It's a choice I can live with.About battery consumption - with all the image processing that goes on to get sharp images, it does eat through the batteries.  BUT - the batteries are incredibly small and to carry three or more extras is just not an issue.  I bought the "generic" brand of batteries so really they didn't cost all that much.Bottom line is that this camera is probably NOT meant for the beginner.  It has features and functions that make it invaluable in certain conditions and if you need those features, you'll love this camera.

Reviews.Title: pentax review
Reviews.Author: Chris Richardson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife ... she is NOT happy with it... the pictures are blurry, she can't seem to get a good picture with it.I have a fuji Z33 and she can do much better with it... and I love it since it's smaller and does at least what I want.  I can get some good pictures with this Pentax.... but it's not like I thought it was going to be. :(I did lots of looking and searching before I bought this too.

Reviews.Title: Great for Snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Gary Kirby "Kirbmeister"
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a cruise in the Bahamas and purchased this camera specifically for snorkeling.  I loved the way the snorkeling pictures and videos turned out.  My only criticism is that the battery is easy to put in backwards and when changing the battery in the ocean this was an issue.Video is available at:[..]I will be posting photos at webshots.  [..]The video is also here, but is is not in HD

Reviews.Title: Takes abuse
Reviews.Author: L. Dobson
Reviews.Content: I got this for a trip to Hawaii and it functioned reliably. The picture speed and quality is not as good as my old Sony DSC-P200, but this camera is FAR more durable. A few days ago we found it clunking around in the washing machine, it had gone through two cycles, just turned it on and it was ready to go, good as new with only slight scratches. If you want a camera you can just throw in the beach bag and not have to worry about it this is the one, it is built like a tank.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Broke My Heart with this One
Reviews.Author: Heather Bell
Reviews.Content: When I first received the Pentax Opti W80 I was thrilled at how easy it was to use and the quality of the first few pictures I took.  I was especially excited to have a camera I could use at the beach and even in the water.  I  took the time carefully to read the manual's instructions regarding maintaining the camera in water etc.  My son and I used the camera for a week, and we were both careful not to leave it out in the sun, jump into the water with it etc.  Unfortunately, the viewer stopped working and we could no longer see our subjects to shoot them, since we could not see them.  What started out as my favorite digital so far, quickly dashed my expectations.  Additionally, as I reviewed the pictures we DID take, I saw a definite decline in the quality of the images.  I sincerely hope I just got a "bad camera," and that my experience is unique.  As I said, the first day using the Pentax Opti W80 and I was hooked.  Unfortunately, the love affair came to an abrupt end.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Dothee "biker chick"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for kayaking and the beach-- but I also use it everywhere. Its a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: can't believe the noise
Reviews.Author: M. Golubitsky
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to purchase this camera but decided to go for it based on the amount of people saying "the noise isn't that bad especially considering you'll be taking photos outside with it." Well, I cannot believe how much noise this camera generates even on the lowest ISO setting. I compared pictures from this camera and my (non-waterproof) Panasonic FX-35 camera and the results were astounding. At first I thought perhaps the screen on this camera wasn't as good or something but then as soon as I loaded test pictures from both cameras on my computer I immediately returned this camera. Either this camera has awful image quality or the FX-35 has incredible image quality, or both. I will be looking for another waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: optio 12.1 MPX Pentax Waterproof camera excelent
Reviews.Author: Omar Noureddin Masoud "Omar Noureddin Masoud"
Reviews.Content: i like this product, the only detail is that you need perfect ilumination to have best graphics, because when you take a picture, the image looks like pixelated, and have like a texture.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: J. Yeager "Jim Y."
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th generation of the optio camera that I've owned... they just keep getting better and I recommend this camera to all my friends for it's quality and durability.

Reviews.Title: "Great Camera, Definitely Worth The Money"
Reviews.Author: Luis M. Garcia "Burger"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and I definitely recommend it...*12.1 megapixels*Waterproof, Dustproof, Coldproof and Shockproof*Wide-angle 5X internal optical zoom

Reviews.Title: good camera to take everywere
Reviews.Content: i had the optio w30, and this one has the same quality whit more features. the best camera for that price!

Reviews.Title: Black and Gold version
Reviews.Author: Brian Higgs
Reviews.Content: I found the black and gold version on another web site. It came with the a 2GB card and the Pentax floating wrist strap. It was also $150 where ever one else was 180-230 just for the camera. I like it alot great deal.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Nathan E. Sturre "Nathan Sturre"
Reviews.Content: i like this camera a lot. it takes beautiful pic's AND vid's. i found this camera on here while researching camera's to buy. when i found this one and saw it was shock resistant and water proof/resistant i started looking everywhere i could think for this camera and price checked it everywhere. Amazon beat everyones price by at least $50. most camera's i found don't have these features on them, and if they come close they are way more expensive.

Reviews.Title: This thing is Great.
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Baker
Reviews.Content: I am was Looking for a 2nd Camera to use everyday other than my DSLR K20D. This camera will not be like the k20 but the abilty to not worry about this thing getting wet is great. It is Built rugged and does take good photos, Just a warning dont think this camera is not going to have the qualities of a bigger camera and it is only a point and shoot. Just so you know. All that aside I love this thing and look foward to many good shots with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome underwater point and shoot
Reviews.Author: whereswayno "whereswayno"

} } } Length:: 1:07 MinsI gave the camera an overall rating of 4 stars because the battery didn't last very long and because pictures at low depths were very blue. In all, it's a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Not for me...
Reviews.Author: A. Chin
Reviews.Content: When I was shopping for a waterproof camera, the important things to me were submersible depth, good image quality, size, and of course cost.  I had an Olympus stylus 720 before and it was only submersible for 10ft.  I really don't need more than 15ft as I do not go in water deeper than that unless I'm scuba diving; and at that point the highest available at 33ft won't do you much good.  So I was really excited about the W80 since it seemed to have met all of my needs; the depth was 16ft, on paper the image quality was good, it was compact, and at around $180... it was a great deal.  Also, let me tell you that I've done some comparing between the Sony TX5, Olympus Stylus 6020 and 8010, Pentax W80 and W90, Casio, and the Panasonic TS2;  the only thing I really didn't do was take an actual picture with each of these.The first couple of pictures I took to test the camera when I received the W80 came out a little blurry on the screen.  I thought it was actually the screen because it looks a little pixelated to begin with but when I transferred the pictures to my computer they were pretty bad.  No matter what I did to change the settings, I couldn't get the camera to take clear pictures.  The only thing I would say is that outdoor pictures are MUCH better than those taken indoors with or without flash.  The pictures were super fuzzy and images seem soft.  Needless to say I returned the camera and opted for the Olympus 6020 which had MUCH better quality images.  I took one in sports mode in water and I could actually see the individual water beads fall when I turned on the water in my sink.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is the worst digital camera I have ever seen.  It may work underwater, but the pictures it takes are similar to digital cameras in the Mid 90's.  It takes more than high Megapixels to take a good image.  This is an absolute piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Need better battery
Reviews.Author: Donald
Reviews.Content: The quality of the battery is the mian concern. Which also affects the picture qaulity when flash is need.

Reviews.Title: Don't Waste your money
Reviews.Author: B. Anthony Delgrasso
Reviews.Content: This camera is JUNK. It takes the worst, grainy pictures I have ever been subjected to by a digital camera.It may be sturdy, and dust proof, and all the other claims are basically true. Except, be real careful with the water proof part. Limit your depth and time in the water or you will be sorry.But the whole thing with a camera is the quality of the pictures. Unfortunately, regardless of the settings, even set on best, best, best; this camera takes the grainiest pictures you will ever experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures for 12 minutes
Reviews.Author: Generik "Opinions"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one after really loving the earlier version of it.  This has all the same features plus a few other such as the 1cm macro that I really like.However, I would not recommend it.  The battery life is so short that it makes it almost unusable.  I purchased 3 extra batteries just to make it through an evening out.Again the camera is nice, but I wouldn't buy it again..

Reviews.Title: SKIP IT OR BE DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Author: Johnny M
Reviews.Content: I got this after doing a ton of research on it through youtube and watching reviews.  I took a few outside pics on a bright sunny day which came out beautiful (after taking about 10, 4 came out really nice).  Pictures are extremely grainy.  I called Pentax and they told me to change the ISO setting for low light which still did not help.  I was originally going to Get the Stylus Tough waterproof camera but I heard this was better and apparently that one isn't too great either.Pictures are grainy no matter what setting.  Not easy to use since you constantly have to fiddle around with settings and my old camera I got 3 years ago was much better and easier to use. If you want a waterproof digital camera for outdoor use, get the Kodak Play sport instead.  I got that after getting this one and I absolutely love it.  Shoots real HD, takes great pics (but has no flash for low light) and I absolutely love it.  I ended up selling this one on craigslist for $100

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Z. Rubemeyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife for Christmas. she wanted one that was waterproof and of a sturdy design. i spent about a month looking at waterproof cameras with little to no luck... till i found this one. this camera was a little more pricey than others but well worth it. works great underwater, supper clean pictures above and below water, and well crafted, almost indestructible.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MamaB "MamaB"
Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely tough and durable. It takes an excellent photo, but you really need to read the whole manual and make sure you use the proper setting for the best picture quality. Overall we are very satified with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: WORST camera I've ever used
Reviews.Author: D. Ponzi
Reviews.Content: I am an SLR user and an avid photographer.  I purchased this camera for it size and the underwater feature. I wanted a small camera that I could take with me to concerts or other events that I either did not want to take my camera case to or to places that my SLR might get damaged.  Well i tried to use this camera twice and i haven't been able to get any good pictures.  I have played with every setting on the camera and I don't know what else to do.  This Camera is getting returned!

Reviews.Title: Save a little more and buy a better camera. Not worth it!
Reviews.Author: Justin Beausoleil
Reviews.Content: This camera takes horrible photos and videos in low light / indoor conditions. Very grainy and blurry. Don't be fooled by the megapixel amount. The image quality is terrible. Even outside in broad daylight you sometimes get big blue streaks or discoloration near the corners on some photos. Save your money and buy something better.

Reviews.Title: I want the free memory card I was supposed to get.
Reviews.Author: Luisa Salazar "Luisa"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, this is not the first Pentax Waterproof I own, but it is way better than the one I got 5 yeras ago.I do have a problem with the delivery since I paid an extra $20 to get it on the next day but got it 5 days later.I also did not get the free gadgets it was supposed to come with like the camera's case, memory card, etc.When I bought it on line the package was made of plastic with the camera and all the gadgets at view, when I got it the camera came on a box without any extra gadgets.Luisa Salazar
